title: PayPal is trying to drag its 435 million users into the $120 billion stablecoin market — here's why
description: The company is entering an extremely crowded market already dominated by stablecoins like tether and USDC. Crypto chief Jose Fernandez da Ponte explains why.

title: From $40 billion to 'going concern' — WeWork warns of possible bankruptcy
description: With losses mounting and cash dwindling, WeWork said in a filing that there's doubt about its potential as a "going concern."

title: ESPN launches sportsbook in partnership with Penn Entertainment
description: Penn Entertainment and Disney's ESPN are partnering to launch a sportsbook, which will be branded ESPN Bet.

title: Rivian raises 2023 EV production guidance, posts narrower-than-expected quarterly loss
description: Rivian now expects to build about 52,000 vehicles in 2023, more than twice the number it made in 2022.

title: Apple is planning to move the button to hang up a call in new iPhone software
description: Apple's iOS 17 will include one of the biggest revamps to the iPhone's phone app in years.

title: Cloud stocks falter as Datadog trims 2023 revenue expectations
description: Organizations continue to look carefully at opportunities to save money on software given economid conditions, and that's hurting cloud stocks.

title: Elon Musk's X aims to win back advertisers with new brand safety technology deal
description: X said on Tuesday that it signed an exclusive partnership with the ad-tech firm Integral Ad Science for brand safety technology.

title: Bitcoin rises from a two-week trading lull as Moody’s downgrade hits U.S. banking sector
description: Bitcoin rose in opposition with the market after the crypto failed to move more than 1% in either direction for 14 straight days.

title: Amazon is running a second Prime Day sale in October
description: The Prime Day sequel comes as retailers are bracing for a downbeat holiday spending season this year.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried still faces campaign finance charges, prosecutors say
description: Federal prosecutors said on Tuesday that they are still planning to charge FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried with campaign finance violations.

title: EverestLabs is using robotic arms and AI to make recycling more efficient
description: EverestLabs puts 3D depth-sensing cameras on recycling conveyor lines to identify materials, then employs robotic arms to pluck out recyclable packaging.

title: Credit card balances jumped in the second quarter and are above $1 trillion for the first time
description: Credit card debt 30 or more days late rose to 7.2% in the second quarter, up from 6.5% in Q1 and the highest rate since the first quarter of 2012.

title: Novo Nordisk shares pop after key trial data shows Wegovy cuts risk of heart attack or stroke by 20%
description: The results of the trial were seen as a major boost for the firm's hopes of moving beyond Wegovy's image as a "vanity drug."

title: Moody's cuts ratings of 10 U.S. banks and puts some big names on downgrade watch
description: Moody's on Monday cut the credit ratings of a host of small and mid-sized U.S. banks and placed several Wall Street big names on negative review.

title: It’s official: Scientists confirm July was the hottest month ever recorded
description: "These records have dire consequences for both people and the planet exposed to ever more frequent and intense extreme events," said C3S's deputy director.

title: Italian bank shares slide after government surprises with windfall tax
description: Italian banking shares took a beating on Tuesday after Italy's cabinet surprised with a 40% windfall tax on lenders' "excess" profits in 2023.

title: SoftBank reports surprise loss in first quarter but Vision Fund books $1 billion investment gain
description: SoftBank surprised the market with a loss in the first quarter, though its Vision Fund booked a $1.1 billion gain on investments.

title: Champagne sales are booming. But its taste could soon change forever — thanks to climate change
description: Europe's soaring temperatures and increasingly volatile weather are sparking fears that France's Champagne region could become unsuitable for its production.

title: Palantir's A.I. ambitions divide analysts. A bull and bear make their cases
description: Palantir bumped up its annual revenue forecast on Monday as it sees an opportunity to commercialize AI, but not all analysts are equally bullish.

title: China releases plans to restrict facial recognition technology
description: China is planning to restrict businesses' use of facial recognition technology in favor of non-biometric methods, according to the Cyberspace Administration.

title: China reports double-digit plunge in July exports and imports, missing expectations
description: China said Tuesday that exports fell by 14.5% in July from a year ago, while imports dropped by 12.4% in U.S. dollar terms.

title: India job seekers aren't ready to return to the office — 2 in 3 say they value flexibility over pay
description: Employees "remain keenly interested in remote work, whereas employers are far less likely to mention 'work from home' in the job ads they post," said Indeed India.

title: China needs to boost productivity given 'demographic challenge,' says economist
description: "If you go back 10, 20 years in China, you had so much of growth coming purely from just more people showing up each year," said Mastercard's David Mann.
